intro: Isotrema yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan isotrema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan province, where it thrives in subtropical forests. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
